headline: Reliable and and professional
pros: Timely paid bills, including late cancellations
cons: None known over the period of 10 years

headline: NONE
pros: Loved working here. They sponsor your series 7/63.
cons: NONE. The company is expelled by Finra.

headline: Churn and Burn
pros: Exposure to the industry and the frat mentality.
cons: No care or concern for people, laws, or SEC.

headline: Broker
pros: unlimited commissions and your own clients
cons: room for growth and poor coaching

headline: Boiler Room
pros: Sales techniques and skills. You learn how to sell any and everything. Unlimited earning potential. Cool knowledge
cons: The environment is impersonal..  The management team are crooks... They don't care... Long hours... Little to no pay at the beginning...

headline: Good intro to the business
pros: Fast paced and difficult but very rewarding if you are meant to be a broker
cons: Lower level firm in a dying business

headline: Sometimes a company can grow too fast.
pros: New owners of broker/dealer tried to keep the business afloat, to no avail.
cons: Firm closure, even after the new owners try to make the firm profitable.

headline: It's a Trap
pros: In every branch there are several big guys making a lot of money. They might even show you how much they're making to reel you in. What they won't tell you is that they will probably use you to bring in new accounts for them, then fire you, take all your accounts, and leave you with nothing. Furthermore they won't tell you that in 2015, hardly any people are dumb enough to buy stock over the phone from a stranger and when the market starts going down, all their accounts bail and they are left on the unemployment line.
cons: Telemarketers posing as "financial advisors" in fancy suits. You know when you see a job ad and it says 6 figure potential in your first year and you think it's too good to be true? Well, it is. They use newly graduated frat boys to cold call for them and prey on older financially illiterate customers seeking a return. If only these customers knew who they were giving their money to.

headline: Great atmosphere
pros: The headquarters office is very professional with great management
cons: Non-stop cold-calling for trainees in the retail brokerage department. Depending what team you are working with, the experience can be very mixed, from extremely positive to very negative.
